Package planning

Class ActionSchema

java.lang.Object
planning.ActionSchema
public class ActionSchema extends Object
An action schema defined for a planning problem. Typically, the schema has a set of variables that must be bound in order for it to be part of a solution. Thus, it is different from search.Action. The subclass ConcreteAction is the planning equivalent of search.Action.
Author:
heflin

  • Constructor Details

    • ActionSchema

      public ActionSchema(String name, Variable[] parameters, Literal[] preconditions, Atom[] addList, Atom[] deleteList)
      Constructor for an action schema. The caller must provide a name, parameters, preconditions, add list and delete list. The addList and deleteList simplify the handling of effects: addList are the positive effects while deleteList are the negative effects.
      Parameters:
      name - Description of the schema
      parameters - An array of variables that parameterize the schema
      preconditions - A lists of literals that must be true for the action to be applicable
      addList - A list of atoms that will be added to the state after performing the action
      deleteList - A list of atoms that will be deleted from the state after performing the action

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the schema.

    • getParameters

      public Variable[] getParameters()
      Returns the parameters of the schema.

    • getPreconditions

      public Literal[] getPreconditions()
      Returns the preconditions of the schema.

    • getAddList

      public Atom[] getAddList()
      Returns the add list of the schema. These are the positive literals in its effects.

    • getDeleteList

      public Atom[] getDeleteList()
      Returns the delete list of the schema. These are the negative literals in its effects.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the name and parameters of the schema.
